sense.name: A tight-fitting headdress.
sense.examples: She gave me a cap for the holidays. You should wear a cap when it's cold outside.

sense.name: A top, perhaps serving as protection.
sense.examples: Put the cap on the bottle before putting it in the fridge. You should place a cap on the margarine.

sense.name: An explosive device.
sense.examples: The gangsters put a cap in him. Caps were laid around the building for detonation.

sense.name: A plant structure near the top of the plant.
sense.examples: The mushroom finally had a cap. The plant protected itself with a cap.

sense.name: An upper limit.
sense.examples: He put a cap on the number of women who worked for him. There was a cap on salaries that year.

sense.name: A dental appliance for a broken tooth.
sense.examples: My cavity required a cap. Caps can now be made of porcelain rather than gold.

sense.name: The upper part of a column.
sense.examples: The columns haev ornate caps at the top.
